item.description:
Ted Slater, Merck & Co., Conference Chair - C-SHALS 2011

CSHALS is the premier annual event focused on the use of semantic technologies in the pharmaceutical industry, including hospitals/healthcare institutions and academic research labs.

Rather than a Semantic Web conference, CSHALS focuses on specific applications of semantic technologies. Attendees will gain a better understanding of where the field is headed and be prepared to advance with the field.

CSHALS is intended for anyone already participating in this groundbreaking field, and a pre-conference tutorial is offered to help interested researchers come up to speed on the practical approaches of applying intelligent information technologies in pharmaceutical R&D.



Josh Shortlidge, President of InterEthos

InterEthos is an internet service that allows taxonomies to be shared, correlated, and internationalized.
It is an open-source project, in its very early stages.



Roland Benedetti, Nuxeo, VP Products

Nuxeo released lately two addons for semantic linking and automatic categorization relying for content and document managed in Nuxeo platforms. These modules are an interesting examples of implementing web semantic technology in Content Applications. I'll introduce briefly Nuxeo and the work done on the Semantic area, showcasing an example based on the two modules.




If you have a recommendations on a presentation or would like to present, please send an email via the Contact Us button on the left.
item.how_to_find_us: 4th floor, Star Conference Room, Stata Center, MIT
item.name: Cambridge Semantic Web Monthly Meetup
